urls.title: Kendal Flood Risk Management Scheme | The Flood Hub
urls.description: Information on this page has been provided by the Environment Agency and was correct at the time of upload. The Flood Hub is not responsible for any information held on this page. For any enquiries, see the Contact section of the

urls.title: Upper Kent | The Flood Hub
urls.description: The Environment Agency is delivering a proposed Flood Risk Management Sc heme to better protect homes and business from flooding in the Kent catchment, and improve the local environment and community amenities. Kendal is the first area to be delivered, followed by Burneside, Staveley, and Ings, and upstream measures including flood storage. In addition, Natural Flood Management measures are being integrated into the plans which aim to slow the flow of water and provide wider environmental benefits across

text: RT @EnvAgencyYNE: Our chair @EmmaHowardBoyd spoke at the launch of the @YHClimateCom this week where she spoke about the need for our regio‚Ä¶
@EnvAgency In other News worlds biggest trawlers fishing our waters for over a year.

@FineCountryside @DefraGovUK @DefraNature @EnvAgency @UKParliament @MoorlandMonitor @WildlifeTrusts @CraigBennett3 @CarolineLucas @PeatlandACTION @IUCNpeat Whenever you burn an upland it's bad for wildlife. There will be nesting birds building their nests now. Insects and invertebrates will have died in the fire. Keeping our uplands wet by blocking drainage ditches and proper management is the way forward.
